DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Status Remission Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the remission status for the disease or disorder.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.value: Complete remission with incomplete platelet recovery (CRp)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Complete Response with Incomplete Platelet Recovery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Complete Response with Incomplete Platelet Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment, accompanied by incomplete platelet recovery (platelet count is less than 100,000/uL).

Concepts.longName: Complete Response with Incomplete Platelet Recovery
Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment, accompanied by incomplete platelet recovery (platelet count is less than 100,000/uL).

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.22 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002191. ak

PermissibleValues.value: Complete remission with incomplete hematologic recovery (CRi)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of cancer, accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.

Concepts.longName: Morphologic Complete Remission with Incomplete Blood Count Recovery
Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of cancer, accompanied by incomplete bone marrow recovery, as evidenced by persistent anemia, thrombocytopenia or neutropenia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The patient had achieved a complete response; received more therapy and continued in complete response.

Concepts.definition: The patient had achieved a complete response; received more therapy and continued in complete response.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by morphological analysis.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer, supported by morphological analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
